Error type — short description.
I bought book yesterday. → I bought a book yesterday.
an university → a university
The love is important. → Love is important.
a information → information ; the cars are expensive (when speaking generally) → cars are expensive
three person → three people ; I have many homework. → I have much homework / a lot of homework.
many advices → much advice / many pieces of advice
two informations → two pieces of information
He go to work. → He goes to work.
The team are winning. → The team is winning. (flag as register option)
Yesterday I go to market. → Yesterday I went to the market.
I study now. → I am studying now. ; I am knowing him. → I know him.
I have seen him yesterday. → I saw him yesterday. ; I saw him since 2019. → I have seen him since 2019.
I have been knowing him for years. → I have known him for years.
I will meeting her tonight. → I'm meeting her tonight. ; It will rain tomorrow. vs It's going to rain. (flag usage)
You coming? → Are you coming? ; He not agree. → He does not agree.
Does he can come? → Can he come?
The letter wrote by Mary. → The letter was written by Mary.
Mistakes were made. (formal) → I made a mistake. (if clarifying responsibility)
If I will see him, I tell him. → If I see him, I'll tell him. ; If I had known, I would go. → If I had known, I would have gone.
If I were rich, I would travel next year. → If I were rich, I would travel now. / or adjust tense appropriately.
The man which spoke to me. → The man who spoke to me.
My sister, who lives in London works here. → My sister, who lives in London, works here. (commas)
Me and him went. → He and I went. ; Give it to I. → Give it to me.
John told Dave that he was wrong. → John told Dave, “You were wrong,” or John told Dave that Dave was wrong. (clarify)
Its a problem. → It's a problem. ; The dog wagged it's tail. → The dog wagged its tail.
I suggested to go. → I suggested going. ; I want studying. → I want to study.
He speaks good. → He speaks well. ; A quickly reply → A quick reply.
a red big car → a big red car
very unique → unique / truly unique
more better → better ; gooder → better ; the most funniest → the funniest
She is taller then me. → She is taller than me. ; He is as tall then I am. → as tall as I am.
I will meet you in 5pm. → at 5pm. ; I am good in tennis. → good at tennis. ; She arrived to Hong Kong. → arrived in Hong Kong.
I wait the bus. → I waited for the bus.
I often go sometimes. → I sometimes go. ; He speaks English well always. → He always speaks English well.
I not can go. → I cannot / can't go.
This book I finished. → I finished this book. (acceptable in some contexts but flag for register/clarity)
I was tired, I went to bed. → I was tired, so I went to bed. or I was tired; I went to bed.
When we arrived. → When we arrived, the show had started. or We arrived.
She likes apples she eats them. → She likes apples; she eats them.
My teacher John is here. → My teacher, John, is here. (if non-restrictive)
The teachers lounge → The teachers' lounge (if plural possessive) ; it's temperature → its temperature
i live in hong kong. → I live in Hong Kong.
make a decision vs do a decision → do → make
open the light → turn on the light ; long time no see (casual OK) → It's been a long time since we last met. (professional)
Give me the report. → Could you send me the report, please?
This is wrong. → I think there might be an issue with this. (flag register)
You're wrong. → I think there's a problem here.
He studied. He failed. → He studied hard; however, he failed.
He said, “I am tired.” → He said he is tired. → He said he was tired. (depending on context)
You are coming, isn't it? → You're coming, aren't you?
I didn't see nothing. → I didn't see anything.
break a rice → break a leg (idiom misuse)
a cotton small red shirt → a small red cotton shirt
A 50% of people → 50% of people ; a half of the students → half of the students / a half (context)
turn the lights off vs turn off the lights (both okay if separable) ; look after vs look for confusion: I look after my keys. → I look for my keys.
revert back → revert ; advance planning → planning
If required, contact. → If required, contact me/us at...
It is John who I met. → correct cleft: It was John whom I met. (depends on focus)
He tall. → He is tall.
I go school yesterday. → I went to school yesterday.
three person → three people ; two piece of advice → two pieces of advice
This cake, I like. → I like this cake. (flag for register/closeness to Cantonese)
Send the report. → Please send the report. or Could you send the report?
He arrived the station. → He arrived at the station. ; She broke the vase. (active vs She was broken.)
Can't / won't in formal email → cannot / will not (flag register)
- to write reports - checking emails - meeting clients → make all verbs parallel: writing, checking, meeting
Chinese full-width comma used in English sentence → flag for typographic correctness.
